definition: mix together/put together (usu. things that do not blend well together)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: And in many cases, the new theories blend economics with entirely different disciplines.
sentences.chinese: 這些新的理論往往會糅合完全不同的學科。

sentences.english: Call Tune - a modern musical «language» mixed dialects from traditional Norwegian folk music.
sentences.chinese: 音樂劇《語言》樂曲，糅合挪威民歌曲風。

sentences.english: What we do is more like a mix of different things together.
sentences.chinese: 我們更像是把不同的東西糅合在一起。

sentences.english: How to blend, the use of classroom teacher-student interaction to achieve the best results.
sentences.chinese: 如何將其糅合，利用師生互動達到最佳課堂效果。

sentences.english: Rego's work is a rich collage of 20th-century painting styles.
sentences.chinese: 瑞格的作品糅合了20世紀各種繪畫風格。

sentences.english: Well, the gradient is also a way to package partials together.
sentences.chinese: 同樣地，梯度也是把偏導數糅合到一起。

definition: a mixture/an amalgam/fusion/welding together/to be in harmony with (nature)/to harmonize with/to fit in
to form a cohesive whole/to fuse together
to merge together (idiom); to unify disparate elements into one whole
